definitions.definition: one of four equal or almost equal parts of something; ¼:
examples: He cut the orange into quarters.
I waited a quarter of an hour and then went home.
It was a quarter to six when I left.
I'll meet you at a quarter past five.

definitions.definition: one of four periods of time into which a year is divided for financial calculations, such as for profits or taxes:
examples: There was a fall in unemployment in the second quarter of the year.

definitions.definition: one of four periods in a game of American football and other ball sports
to cut something into four parts
